# Extended attributes (Forensics #3)

## Description
```
In the early hours of today, our janitor has found a USB flash drive taped to a rock, which was lying among the shards of a third floor window...
The only thing present on the drive was this text file containing three words "extended attributes" and "png"
Your task is to find the meaning of this message.
Best of luck.
```

---

Unfortunately this task broke when transfered and we had to improvise ...
The following was added to the original description:

```
Sorry guys, can't seem to get a file with extended attributes intact to work ...Here is the value of the extended attribute in question: 
```

## Solution
The participant gets a file.
When read, the file contains three words: extended attributes and png.
So you try to get the extended attribute using `gettfattr` and get a hexadecimal string (*this was the part that had to be supplied directly*).
Now you reverse hex dump the data into a .png file using `xxd -r`.
Open the .png file and decode the text inside from Base64 back to ascii using `base64 -d`.
The decoded text is the flag.
